translations: Frederick.

sentences: 소들이 풀을 뜯고 말들이 뛰노는 풀밭이 있었습니다.
그 풀밭을 따라 오래된 돌담이 죽 둘러쳐져 있었습니다.
translations: There was a grassy field where cows grazed and horses played happily.
Around the meadow, there was an old stone wall that wrapped all the way around.

sentences: 헛간과 곳간에서 가까운 이 돌담에는 수다쟁이 들쥐 가족의 보금자리가 있었습니다.
translations: Near the barn and the granary, there was a cozy home for a chatty family of mice in the stone wall.

sentences: 농부들이 이사를 가자, 헛간은 버려지고 곳간은 텅 비었습니다.
겨울이 다가오자, 작은 들쥐들은 옥수수와 나무 열매와 밀과 짚을 모으기 시작했습니다.
단 한 마리, 프레드릭만 빼고 말입니다.
translations: When the farmers moved away, the barn was left empty and the storage shed was bare.
As winter was coming, the little field mice began to gather corn, fruit from trees, wheat, and straw.
The little mice worked very hard, day and night.
But there was one little mouse, Frederick, who didn't work at all.

sentences: “나도 일하고 있어. 난 춥고 어두운 겨울날들을 위해 햇살을 모으는 중이야.”
translations: "Frederick, why aren't you working?" the field mice asked.
The little mice asked.
"I am working too! I am gathering sunshine for the cold and dark winter days."
Frederick replied.

sentences: 어느 날, 들쥐들은 동그마니 앉아 풀밭을 내려다보고 있는 프레드릭을 보았습니다.
translations: One day, the field mice saw Frederick sitting in a circle, looking down at the grassy field.
The field mice asked again.
The field mice asked again, "Frederick, what are you doing right now?"
"I'm collecting colors because everything is gray in winter."
Frederick answered briefly.

sentences: 한 번은 프레드릭이 조는 듯이 보였습니다.
그러나 프레드릭은, “아니야, 난 지금 이야기를 모으고 있어. 기나긴 겨울엔 얘기거리가 동이 나잖아.” 했습니다.
translations: One time, it looked like Frederick was starting to doze off.
"Frederick, are you daydreaming?"
The little mice said as if they were scolding.
But Frederick said, "No, I'm gathering stories right now. During the long winter, we run out of things to talk about."

sentences: 첫눈이 내리자, 작은 들쥐 다섯 마리는 돌담 틈새로 난 구멍으로 들어갔습니다.
translations: Winter has come.
As the first snow began to fall, five little mice hurried into a hole in the stone wall.

sentences: 들쥐들은 바보 같은 늑대와 어리석은 고양이 얘기를 하며 지냈습니다.
translations: At first, there was plenty of food.
The field mice spent their time talking about the silly wolf and the foolish cat.
The field mice family was very happy.

sentences: 그러나 들쥐들은 나무 열매며 곡식 낟알들을 조금씩조금씩 다 갉아먹었습니다.
짚도 다 떨어져 버렸고, 옥수수 역시 아스라한 추억이 되어 버렸습니다.
들쥐들은 누구 하나 재잘대고 싶어하지 않았습니다.
translations: But the little field mice nibbled away at the tree fruits and grains bit by bit.
The straw was all gone, and the corn became a distant memory.
A cool breeze slipped through the stone walls.
The field mice didn't want to chat with anyone.

sentences: 그러던 들쥐들은, 햇살과 색깔과 이야기를 모은다고 했던 프레드릭의 말이 생각났습니다.
translations: Then the little field mice remembered what Frederick had said about gathering sunshine, colors, and stories.
"How is your food, Frederick?" the field mice asked.
The field mice asked.

sentences: 프레드릭이 커다란 돌 위로 기어 올라가더니,
“눈을 감아 봐. 내가 너희들에게 햇살을 보내 줄게. 찬란한 금빛 햇살이 느껴지지 않니?” 했습니다.
프레드릭이 햇살 얘기를 하자, 네 마리 작은 들쥐들은 몸이 점점 따뜻해지는 것을 느낄 수 있었습니다.
translations: Frederick climbed up on a big rock.
"Close your eyes. I will send you sunshine. Can you feel the warm, golden sunlight?" he said.
When Frederick talked about the sunshine, the four little field mice felt their bodies getting warmer and warmer.
Could it be because of Frederick's voice?
Could it be because of magic?

sentences: 프레드릭은 파란 덩굴꽃과, 노란 밀짚 속의 붉은 양귀비꽃, 또 초록빛 딸기 덤불 얘기를 들려 주었습니다.
들쥐들은 마음 속에 그려져 있는 색깔들을 또렷이 볼 수 있었습니다.
translations: "What color is it, Frederick?" the little mice asked eagerly.
The little mice asked with a bit of worry.
"Close your eyes again."
Frederick told stories about blue vine flowers, red poppies in yellow straw, and green strawberry bushes.
The mice could see the bright colors that were painted in their hearts.

sentences: 프레드릭은 목소리를 가다듬으며 잠시 동안 가만히 있었습니다.
그리고는 마치 무대 위에서 공연이라도 하듯 말하기 시작했습니다.
유월의 네 잎 클로버는 누가 피워 낼까?
너희들과 나 같은 들쥐 네 마리.
프레드릭이 이야기를 마치자, 들쥐들은 박수를 치며 감탄을 했습니다.
translations: "What is the story?"
Frederick took a moment to gather his voice and stayed still for a little while.
Then he started to speak as if he were performing on a stage.
"Who will sprinkle the snowflakes?"
Who will melt the ice?
I wonder who brings the rainy weather?
I wonder who brings the sunny weather?
Who will make the four-leaf clover bloom in June?
Who makes the day turn into night?
Who brings the bright moonlight to the night?
It's four little mice that live in the sky.
Four little field mice like you and me.
The spring mouse brings the rain with it.
The summer mouse paints all the flowers with beautiful colors.
The autumn mouse brings fruits and wheat.
The winter mouse curls up its little body, feeling cozy.
How wonderful it is to have four seasons!
"There are just the right four seasons, not too many and not too few."
When Frederick finished his story, the little mice clapped their paws and cheered in delight.
"Frederick, you are a poet!"

sentences: 프레드릭은 얼굴을 붉히며 인사를 한 다음, 수줍게 말했습니다.
translations: Frederick blushed as he greeted and then spoke shyly.
"I know too."
